title: SpaceX’s second private Crew Dragon astronaut launch slips to April 8th
summary: SpaceX’s second private astronaut launch and the first fully private crewed mission to the International Space Station (ISS) has been delayed again,...

title: Telesat gets security clearance to serve US government directly
summary: Canada’s Telesat said April 4 it has gained the security clearances it needs to sell directly to U.S. government customers.

title: Space experiment to push standardization in small satellites
summary: An experiment scheduled to launch this fall on Virgin Orbit’s LauncherOne rocket will try to show a faster and cheaper way for the space industry to test technologies on orbit.

title: The space arms race keeps accelerating, new reports warn
summary: As space becomes increasingly important to terrestrial activities, the tools and weapons available to disrupt and damage satellites are proliferating around the world, according to two reports released April 4.

title: SpaceX aces 12th launch of 2022, delivering dozens of satellites to orbit
summary: SpaceX has aced its 12th launch of 2022 just a day over three months into the year, demonstrating a major leap in...

title: NASA to Provide Update Today on Last Major Artemis Test Before Launch
summary: NASA to Provide Update Today on Last Major Test Before Artemis Launch

title: NASA scrubs first attempt at SLS countdown rehearsal
summary: NASA called off the first attempt to fuel its Space Launch System rocket and go through a practice countdown April 3, citing a problem with the rocket’s mobile launcher.

title: Rogozin delays decision on space station future
summary: After Western nations refused his demand to end sanctions on Russian companies involved in the International Space Station, the head of Roscosmos said he will make recommendations in the “near future” on Russia’s continued participation in the station, but there are no signs of any near-term changes in station operations.

title: Private mission ready for launch to the ISS
summary: The first private mission to the International Space Station by an American vehicle is scheduled to launch this week to serve as a first step in one company’s plans to establish a commercial space station.

title: SLS in wet dress rehearsal, final major pre-flight test for NASA moon rocket
summary: With the arrival of SLS and Orion at Pad-B on March 18, engineers and technicians were busy making final preparations for Sunday’s critical last design verification test: the Wet Dress Rehearsal, or WDR.
